Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY! Roach Motel; pics deceiving”
Reviews.Author: sandra c
Reviews.Content: Well for starters there is no such thing as customer service. I checked in and avised that I would be staying for at least a month but would be paying daily. Keep in mind, With a $50 deposit, my second day i was not even $20 dollars short and said i would be paying the remainder in an hour. Mr. Brown dude Kyler at the front desk who can BARELY speak english, asked me to leave. And not even politely, i might add. Going on and on that i was apparently asking for the world in my palms! During my stay, couldnt sleep as the sound of the Gardiner Expressway (busy hwy) kept me up. Internet connection is patchy Wasnt the only one occupying my room; met mr roach in the bathroom Extremely cheap soap and towels smelled of bleach and were to tough for my skin And the pics of the room on their website are deceiving. They show the renovated rooms on their site but put me in the crap room! Old furniture. TV from 1912. Old linens. Carpet and broadloom smelled like bodily fluids! Wouldnt be surprised if i caught a disease Mr Kyler needs to return to school and learn the hospitality industry from square one as I believe was away they taught customer service. NOT RECOMMENDED ONE BIT! STAY AWAY there is a 100x better place down the street - Stay Inn

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Accomodations in the City”
Reviews.Author: adavici
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an affordable, clean hotel room in the city of Toronto and aren't too picky about ammeneites or location, then the CBVI is a good option. The hotel is on the West end of the city near a mall and a couple major freeways. There's not really much you can walk to as far as restaurants or entertainment. At the same time, it didn't really seem like a bad neighborhood or anything. My room was in the second building and backed up to Evans Ave and the traffic was a little loud, but I would imagine rooms off the street would be a bit quieter. The room was clean - nothing stuck out as nasty or grimey. The decor and carpet are all a bit dated and worn, and there was no soap or coffee maker in the room. The towels and linens are not the finest quality. But all that said - for the price (under $100) I was quite satisfied with a clean, safe room within the city. One funny thing - the shower had 2 shower heads! One was the standard wall mount, then there was one of the big, rain spout types from the ceiling. It was like a strage little luxury in an otherwise average room! This isn't the place I will stay at with my wife for a romantic weekend, but when I am looking for a cheap room for a night on a quick in-and-out of Toronto weekend, I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Steve J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 days. Great value. Everything else was on average level i must say.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: x_sailr
Reviews.Content: This property is tucked into a small quasi-residential area between the "East" and "West" malls on the east side of Toronto. It is a very good location to access the Toronto downtown via the Metro Kipling Station. The room we had (with a AAA discount) was quite reasonable - $100-150US less expensive than the downtown properties. The rooms aren't anything special but our was clean and user-friendly. The microwave/'fridge is a nice touch. (The also have kitchenette studios.) The staffing was a little light and American English is definitely not their strong suit. But then again, we sometimes have a hard time with Canadian, eh? They were quite helpful when they appeared.

Reviews.Title: “Still like this place”
Reviews.Author: Clamato
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 4 times for a total of 10 nights and still like this place when visiting Toronto. I take back my earlier comment about the rooms not being suitable for a large person. Only my first room's washroom was small, my other 3 rooms would have accommodated a large person. This place is the best price for someone visiting the west side of Toronto or planning to visit cities west of Toronto. Quiet, comfortable bed. It is important to note that I always request and stay in the new building. However, I believe the older part has been renovated

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, Unclean room, Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Denise_O1974
Reviews.Content: I came to Toronto for a wedding with a group of 20 family members. We were assured that all the rooms would be together, whereas some family members were in a different building all together. DO not be deceived by the pictures, they have since done renovations, and the business suites no longer look like the photos. When family members asked for discounts due to the misconception of the rooms, they refused and didn't offer an apology. The first night I had stayed in my room, the sheets smelled like they had not been changed. We had put the towels in the bathtub for new ones to be put in the room, only they took the towels out of the tub and put them back in the holder. Would never stay here again!! BAD SERVICE, UNCLEAN ROOMS, VERY NOISY DUE TO HIGHWAY NOISE

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for the Right Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Clamato
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to be on the west side of Toronto close to major arteries and don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room, this is a new, clean, quiet, motel at the best rate you will probably find. Rooms are small, European in size, with tiny bathroom and shower only, but it had a desk to work at and use the free internet. This place is not for you if you are a large person, struggling with your weight, are a family planning to spend a lot of time in your room or a person without a car. The free parking was great but for a person dependent on transit I think there would be better locations. It was walking distance to a major shopping mall. I don't recall it being advertised but there was a small continental breakfast in the lobby. Front desk staff were friendly. Area was a mix of light industrial and older residential and did not seem scary in any way. In Oct 2010 I paid just short of $82 taxes included as a single rate with motor league discount.

Reviews.Title: “It really is the "Besr Value Inn"”
Reviews.Author: Jocelyn829
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a shabby run down place at that price. Was I pleasantly surprised! My room was very much like one you'd find in a new Holiday Inn etc. Extremely clean, nicely decorated, with flat screen TV, fridge, and microwave. The bathroom was modern with even a rain shower head. No shampoo, lotions etc. But how much do you expect for that price? It is in a combination commercial/residential area. Very quiet at night. Public Transit at the door. Within walking distance of Sherway Gardens - a great mall. Convenient to highways, but not close enough to hear the traffic. Must drive to a restaurant for breakfast though.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional quality/price ratio”
Reviews.Author: _d4ve_w
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling on a budget quite a few times and this is by far the best quality/price ratio I've encountered. Be sure to ask for a room in the new non smoking area. Bring your laptop to enjoy free wi-fi internet access. Very friendly staff. Don't pay 35$ CND for a taxi ride to the airport, use their shuttle service for 5$. A few convenience stores in the vicinity, including a bigger Chinese food store. Go there, buy a little food and stuff the mini-fridge. Use the micro-wave to reheat pizza left-overs. A short bus ride (#123) will take you to the nearest metro station (Kipling). Big shopping mall at a walking distance. Cable TV with a lot of channels.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for singles - not a family joint”
Reviews.Author: wardo99
Reviews.Content: If you are a non-smoker be sure to ask for the new non-smoking only block just to the east of the main building. Situated between Evans Ave and the Gardiner Expressway, the location will be a bit noisy for light sleepers. The rate was okay for it's location in the city (CAD$69 + taxes). My room was equipped with a tub-sized shower enclosure but no tub and a very large secondary shower head that dripped freezing drops when the normal wall-mounted shower head was used. I used this motel to stay for a friend's funeral. I wouldn't recommend it for a stay longer than a couple of nights. Single guys will have no trouble with it but couples and families can certainly pass this one by...

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: CTrw
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have stayed somewhere else in Canada to see if this really is the best value. I payed 71.99/night even though the sign outside advertised rooms for 69.99/night. The clerk said it was because I had a previous reservation. Now that's value! It is a modern motel with most of the things you would expect. Mini-fridge, microwave, coffee in the lobby, hair dryer, HBO and wireless internet. It is located right next to the QEW but I got a room near the front so noise wasn't a problem. What I didn't expect was half a Molson in the fridge, someone else's socks in the drawer and crickets in the room. There may have been wireless internet but I never got the right log-in code from the staff. On the map the motel appeared close to downtown Toronto. It's not and there is nothing within walking distance. There is a brand new American style Mall and some strip mall shopping with McD's and Walmart and some other various mega chain food outlets. All of which are close by car near Queens Ways road. It certainly was not the worst motel, but I question if it was the best value.

Reviews.Title: “Can I give negative stars??”
Reviews.Author: trugrad
Reviews.Content: Where do I start?? After reading the reviews here and hearing good things from family about some Americas Best Value Inn, I booked 2 nights. We arrived in Toronto after being on the road for 14 hours. When I pulled in the parking lot I was a little concerned. Just didn't look like a great side of town. I got out of the car and noticed the bullet proof glass at the check in area. In my mind I am still remembering all the good reviews I had read. Trying not to judge a book by its cover. When we got to the room I had to put all of my weight against the door to open it. The room was a good size. It smelled pretty musty. Sat down on the bed and almost went to the floor. NO SUPPORT. My husband laid down on the other side and rolled right into me. The toilet seat had to be held up while going to the bathroom. The AC unit was nasty. When I went to turn the knob it came off in my hand. Couldn't figure out why it was not working, then my husband noticed it was not plugged in. I called the front desk to inquire about the free wireless internet. I immediately began looking for another hotel. When I found some other "deals" on the net. I went to the front desk to ask for a refund. I don't know where to start. The clerk at the front desk said we had been in there for an hour, she can't refund my money. She went on to ask if the room had been "USED". UMMMM did we.....?? Nope had spent the hour looking for another room. I was willing to try another room in the hotel, but the clerks attitiude just got worse and worse. She wanted to inspect the room before she would give us a refund. When she followed us to the room and the bed was not in disarray, she continued with the attitiude. When we explained that we were tired and a good bed was one of the top priorities, she asked if the bed was the only problem. Horrible customer service, not great location. Will not stay here again and will warn anyone I know heading to Toronto to not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: morse999
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights while awaiting our return flight to the UK. The room was very clean with a microwave and fridge and satellite TV. The bed was quite comfortable and the staff very helpful and friendly. There is high speed free internet access in the lobby area and the shuttle bus to the airport is very reasonable. This is not the Hilton or Sheraton but if you want a clean quiet place to sleep near to public transport, this is it. RKL Chesterfield UK

Reviews.Title: “Practical accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Sevillefla
Reviews.Content: Our three-night stay, at C$60 per night for a queen-sized bed, was quite satisfactory. The room was non-smoking, freshly decorated and clean; the staff courteous and friendly. There is free internet access from a computer in the front office to check e-mail. etc. There is nothing elegrant about the motel, but it is practical for people requiring simple overnight accommodation. It is easily accessed from the QEW, on the western edge of Toronto, about 20 minutes from downtown. --Two US seniors

Reviews.Title: “Best Value to my money”
Reviews.Author: Josh2000
Reviews.Content: This is small hotel may be 50-60 rooms but rooms are very clean, beds are so comfortable I slept like baby. Front staff is so co-operative, they give me lot of information about Toronto, though it was my first visit. Free high speed internet was really useful. Cleaning staff is also good, best thing is a big shopping mall is in next to the hotel. My overall experience was very good with this hotel, especially the money I paid for the room was nothing, I am sure if I rent same room in downtown I would pay double the amount and this hotel is just 10 minutes away to the down town. I am very happy with the room and my stay.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs ?”
Reviews.Author: littleguy
Reviews.Content: Room 22 First appearence can be deceiving. The staff seemed very friendly . They told us how they had done all kinds of work improving the Inn. Up grading the room new decor . It looked and sounded good. Entering the room it looked great , comfortable. Nice and quiet. We stayed for two nights. But look out. After the first night I started exsperiance some itchy spots. They puffed up , simmilar to misquitoe bites .Thinking that was what it was , I gave it no more thought. After the second night I seemed to have far more bies and when telling my roomy she to had the same excperiance . She had also noticed small bugs in the room.. Then strating to wonder we had not seen any mosquitoes anywhere. Guess what BED BUGS. It was confermed at my Dr. the next day. . . after the bites began looking almost like blistors. I had a very bad reaction to the bites. So beware looks are not always what they seem. If it wasn't for the bugs it wood have been a great place. M+G Kingston Ont.

HotelInfo.Name: Canadas Best Value Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 650 Evans Avenue, Toronto, Ontario M8W-2W6, Canada
